title: 111_hr899
content: The Act is titled the "Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act" and requires a special election in case of a vacancy in the office of a Senator. The "Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act" mandates a special election to fill a Senate vacancy. The President of the Senate certifies the vacancy, and the state's chief executive must issue a writ of election within 90 days. State laws govern the special election, except in cases near a regularly scheduled election. The "Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act" requires a special election to fill a Senate vacancy. The state's chief executive can make a temporary appointment until the special election is held. SEC. 3. REIMBURSEMENT OF PORTION OF COSTS INCURRED BY STATE IN HOLDING SPECIAL ELECTION. This section amends the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to provide payments to states to reimburse a portion of the costs incurred in holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies. The Commission will make payments to eligible States to cover a portion of the costs incurred in holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies. States must submit a statement with cost details to receive a payment equal to 50% of the reasonable costs. The Commission will make payments to States for holding special elections, covering 50% of reasonable costs incurred. Payments will be made within 30 days of receiving the State's cost statement. States must agree to repay any overpayments exceeding actual election costs. Authorization of appropriations for payments under this part to reimburse States for holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies is granted for fiscal year 2009 and beyond.
